text: [Music]
hello i'm roshali a cloud support
engineer here at the aws office in
dallas
today i'm going to show you how to
increase the bin log retention for your
amazon aurora my sequel db cluster
let's get started
with eroda mysql compatibledb cluster
you can increase the availability of
your aurora mysql compatible clusters
bin logs by increasing the bin log
retention period using the amazon
relational database services predefined
mysql rds set configuration procedure
please note
turning on bin log for your aurora mysql
compatibledb cluster has performance
effects
make sure that you review the knowledge
article listed to increase the bin log
retention for an aurora mysql compatible
db cluster we need a custom cluster
level db parameter group as users cannot
update or modify parameters listed in
the default cluster level db parameter
group after logging into the aws
management console navigate to the rds
console
then select the parameter groups from
the left pane on the rds console
to create a custom cluster level db
parameter group select the create
parameter group button choose the aurora
parameter group family according to your
aurora mysql compatible db clusters
engine version
make sure that you select the type as db
cluster parameter group from the
drop-down list
enter an identifier for the db cluster
parameter group provide an appropriate
description for your easy reference
choose create
after you successfully create an aurora
db cluster parameter group
on the parameter groups page search for
the newly created tb cluster parameter
group
select the parameter group
now select edit parameters at the top
right corner of the console
in the parameters list use the search
bar and search for the parameter bin log
format
by default the bin log parameter is set
to off you can then change the value to
row or statement or mixed as needed for
your use case
here
i'll set the bin log parameter to mixed
and then choose save changes now that we
have a custom cluster db parameter group
navigate to the list of databases on the
rds console
select your amazon aurora mysql
compatible db cluster
and then choose the modify button at the
top right corner on the console on the
modification page scroll down to the
additional configuration pane and select
the custom db cluster parameter group
from the drop-down list provided
choose continue
choose your preferred method to schedule
this modification and then choose modify
cluster
here i'll apply the modification
immediately
to apply the changes of the new custom
db cluster parameter group you must
reboot the cluster
so let's go ahead and reboot the writer
instance of the cluster
please note rebooting the writer
instance in a cluster reboots all the
readers in that cluster when the cluster
is available go ahead and connect to the
aurora cluster using the cluster's
writer endpoint verify the bin lock
parameter using the showglobal variables
query while connected to your aurora db
cluster check the bin log retention
hours using the mysql rds show
configuration procedure
by default the bin log retention is set
to null
to increase the bin log retention run
the aws rds predefined mysql rds set
configuration procedure
and set the retention period as needed
for your use case
here i'll set the bin log retention to
168 hours which is 7 days finally to
verify that the bin log retention period
is updated call the mysql rds show
configuration procedure it returns the
value you set for the bin log retention
period in the previous step
so now you know how to increase the bin
log retention in your aurora mysql
compatible db cluster thanks for
watching and happy cloud computing from
all of us here at aws
[Music]
you
